LOCATION.name: Mordor
LOCATION.description: Also known as the Black Land and the Land of Shadow, Mordor is a dark and desolate land ruled by the Dark Lord Sauron. It is dominated by the Dark Tower of Barad-dûr and Mount Doom, where the One Ring was forged.  A place of evil and fear, it is home to orcs, trolls, and other foul creatures.
LOCATION.significance: The ultimate destination of Frodo's quest to destroy the One Ring.

LOCATION.name: The Shire
LOCATION.description: A peaceful and idyllic land inhabited by hobbits. It is characterized by rolling hills, green fields, and the comforts of hobbit-holes. Divided into four Farthings, the Shire is largely self-governing and isolated from the troubles of the wider world.
LOCATION.significance: Frodo's homeland and a symbol of the simple life he must leave behind.

LOCATION.name: Hobbiton
LOCATION.description: A village within the Shire, home to Bilbo and Frodo Baggins at Bag End. It is the location of Bilbo's eleventy-first birthday party and the starting point of Frodo's journey.
LOCATION.significance: The initial setting and the place where Frodo inherits the One Ring.

LOCATION.name: Bag End
LOCATION.description: Bilbo and Frodo's home, a luxurious hobbit-hole built into The Hill. It is known for its beautiful gardens and rumored to contain vast treasures.
LOCATION.significance: Frodo's home and the place where the story begins.

LOCATION.name: Buckland
LOCATION.description: A region on the eastern border of the Shire, settled by the Brandybuck family. It is bordered by the Brandywine River and the Old Forest.
LOCATION.significance: Frodo purchases Crickhollow in Buckland as a decoy destination.

LOCATION.name: Brandy Hall
LOCATION.description: The ancestral home of the Brandybuck family, a large and sprawling residence with numerous rooms and tunnels. Frodo spent part of his childhood there.
LOCATION.significance: Frodo's childhood home and a place associated with the Brandybuck family.

LOCATION.name: Bywater
LOCATION.description: A village near Hobbiton, located beside a grey pool. It is mentioned as a place where news and rumors spread.
LOCATION.significance: A neighboring village to Hobbiton, part of the Shire community.

LOCATION.name: The Ivy Bush
LOCATION.description: A small inn on the Bywater road, where locals gather to discuss news and events. Ham Gamgee, the Gaffer, often holds forth there.
LOCATION.significance: A place of local gossip and information exchange.

LOCATION.name: Michel Delving
LOCATION.description: The chief township of the Shire, located on the White Downs. It is home to the Mathom-house, a museum of hobbit artifacts.
LOCATION.significance: The main administrative center of the Shire.

LOCATION.name: The Old Forest
LOCATION.description: A dense and ancient forest bordering Buckland. Its trees are described as being sentient and hostile to strangers.
LOCATION.significance: Frodo and his companions travel through it as a shortcut to avoid the Black Riders.

LOCATION.name: Crickhollow
LOCATION.description: A small house purchased by Frodo as a decoy destination. It is located in the country beyond Bucklebury.
LOCATION.significance: Frodo's temporary home and a key part of his plan to leave the Shire secretly.

LOCATION.name: Bree
LOCATION.description: A village east of the Shire, inhabited by both Men and hobbits. It is an ancient meeting place of roads and home to the Prancing Pony inn.
LOCATION.significance: The hobbits stop at Bree on their journey and meet Strider (Aragorn).

LOCATION.name: The Prancing Pony
LOCATION.description: An inn in Bree kept by Barliman Butterbur. It is a gathering place for locals, travelers, and Rangers.
LOCATION.significance: Frodo and his companions stay at the Prancing Pony and encounter danger.

LOCATION.name: Chetwood
LOCATION.description: A forest near Bree, mentioned as a place where some hobbits live.
LOCATION.significance: Part of the Bree-land and a place the hobbits pass through on their journey.

LOCATION.name: Rivendell
LOCATION.description: Also known as Imladris, Rivendell is a hidden valley and the last homely house east of the Sea. It is home to Elrond and the Elves.
LOCATION.significance: A place of refuge and healing for Frodo, where the Council of Elrond takes place.

LOCATION.name: The Barrow-downs
LOCATION.description: A range of hills east of the Old Forest, known for the Barrow-wights that inhabit the ancient barrows.
LOCATION.significance: Frodo and his companions encounter danger and are captured by a Barrow-wight.

LOCATION.name: Woodhall
LOCATION.description: A village in the Shire, located near the Woody End.
LOCATION.significance: A landmark on the hobbits' journey through the Shire.

LOCATION.name: Tower Hills
LOCATION.description: Hills beyond the western marches of the Shire, where three Elf-towers can be seen.
LOCATION.significance: A landmark and a reminder of the Elves' presence in Middle-earth.

LOCATION.name: Grey Havens
LOCATION.description: Harbours located west of the Shire, from which Elven ships sail to Valinor.
LOCATION.significance: The departure point for Elves leaving Middle-earth.

LOCATION.name: Misty Mountains
LOCATION.description: A vast mountain range that runs through Middle-earth. It is home to Orcs, trolls, and other dangers.
LOCATION.significance: A major geographical barrier and a place of peril for the travelers.

LOCATION.name: Mirkwood
LOCATION.description: A large and dark forest in the East of Middle-earth, once known as Greenwood the Great. It is home to spiders, Orcs, and other evil creatures.
LOCATION.significance: A place of darkness and danger, mentioned in connection with the Enemy's growing power.

LOCATION.name: Anduin
LOCATION.description: The Great River of Middle-earth, flowing from the north to the south. It is an important waterway and a boundary between lands.
LOCATION.significance: The hobbits travel on the Anduin after leaving Lothlórien.

LOCATION.name: Lothlórien
LOCATION.description: Also known as Lórien, it is a realm of the Elves, ruled by Celeborn and Galadriel. It is a place of beauty and magic, where the trees have golden leaves in autumn.
LOCATION.significance: The Company finds refuge and receives gifts in Lothlórien.

LOCATION.name: Moria
LOCATION.description: Also known as Khazad-dûm, Moria is an ancient Dwarven city and mine complex beneath the Misty Mountains. It is now a dark and dangerous place.
LOCATION.significance: The Company travels through Moria and encounters the Balrog.

LOCATION.name: Caras Galadhon
LOCATION.description: The Elven city in Lothlórien, where Celeborn and Galadriel dwell. It is described as a city of trees with many flets and lights.
LOCATION.significance: The center of Lothlórien and the place where the Company meets Galadriel.

LOCATION.name: Cerin Amroth
LOCATION.description: A hill in Lothlórien covered with green grass and mallorn trees. It is the heart of the ancient realm and the mound of Amroth.
LOCATION.significance: A place of beauty and memory in Lothlórien.

LOCATION.name: Isengard
LOCATION.description: A fortress located in a circular valley surrounded by sheer rocks. It is home to Orthanc, a tall tower of stone.
LOCATION.significance: Saruman dwells in Isengard and betrays Gandalf.

LOCATION.name: Orthanc
LOCATION.description: A tall tower of stone in Isengard, built by the Men of Númenor. It is Saruman's stronghold.
LOCATION.significance: Gandalf is imprisoned on top of Orthanc by Saruman.

LOCATION.name: Rohan
LOCATION.description: Also known as the Riddermark, Rohan is a land of horsemen, allied with Gondor. It is located between the Misty Mountains and the White Mountains.
LOCATION.significance: Gandalf travels to Rohan to seek aid and finds Shadowfax.

LOCATION.name: Edoras
LOCATION.description: The capital city of Rohan, where the king dwells.
LOCATION.significance: Gandalf visits Edoras on his way to the Shire.

LOCATION.name: Emyn Muil
LOCATION.description: A range of bleak hills east of the Anduin, bordering the Dead Marshes.
LOCATION.significance: The Company travels through the Emyn Muil after leaving Lothlórien.

LOCATION.name: Rauros
LOCATION.description: Great falls on the Anduin, where the River thunders down from Nen Hithoel.
LOCATION.significance: A major landmark on the Anduin and a point where the Fellowship breaks.

LOCATION.name: Amon Hen
LOCATION.description: One of the three peaks at the southern end of Nen Hithoel, known as the Hill of Sight. It has an ancient high seat on its summit.
LOCATION.significance: Frodo climbs Amon Hen and is tempted by the Ring.

LOCATION.name: Amon Lhaw
LOCATION.description: One of the three peaks at the southern end of Nen Hithoel, known as the Hill of Hearing.
LOCATION.significance: A landmark near Amon Hen.

LOCATION.name: Tol Brandir
LOCATION.description: A tall island in the Anduin, also known as the Tindrock. It is located near the falls of Rauros.
LOCATION.significance: A major landmark on the Anduin and a point where the Fellowship must choose its path.

LOCATION.name: Parth Galen
LOCATION.description: A green lawn at the foot of Amon Hen, a fair place in the summer days of old.
LOCATION.significance: The Company camps at Parth Galen and makes the decision to break the Fellowship.

LOCATION.name: Minas Tirith
LOCATION.description: Originally Minas Anor, the Tower of the Setting Sun, it was renamed Minas Tirith, the Tower of Guard, after the fall of Minas Ithil. It is the capital of Gondor.
LOCATION.significance: Boromir's home city and a major stronghold of Men.

CHARACTER.name: Bilbo Baggins
CHARACTER.description: Old hobbit, fond of his garden and the Shire, formerly adventurous

CHARACTER.name: Frodo Baggins
CHARACTER.description: Bilbo's heir, fond of the Shire

CHARACTER.name: Lobelia Sackville-Baggins
CHARACTER.description: Otho's wife, dislikes Bilbo and Frodo

CHARACTER.name: Thorin Oakenshield
CHARACTER.description: Leader of the dwarves on the quest for Erebor

CHARACTER.name: Gollum
CHARACTER.description: Loathsome creature, former hobbit, obsessed with the Ring

CHARACTER.name: Bandobras Took
CHARACTER.description: Known as Bullroarer, very tall hobbit

CHARACTER.name: Marcho
CHARACTER.description: One of the Fallohide brothers who founded the Shire

CHARACTER.name: Blanco
CHARACTER.description: One of the Fallohide brothers who founded the Shire

CHARACTER.name: Tobold Hornblower
CHARACTER.description: First to grow pipe-weed in the Shire

CHARACTER.name: Isengrim the Second
CHARACTER.description: Thain of the Shire during Tobold Hornblower's time

CHARACTER.name: Dora Baggins
CHARACTER.description: Drogo's sister, wrote Bilbo long letters

CHARACTER.name: Hugo Bracegirdle
CHARACTER.description: Borrowed books and didn't return them

CHARACTER.name: Sméagol
CHARACTER.description: Later known as Gollum, murdered Déagol for the Ring

CHARACTER.name: Isildur
CHARACTER.description: Elendil's son, cut the Ring from Sauron's hand

CHARACTER.name: Aragorn
CHARACTER.description: Also called Strider, helped Gandalf find Gollum

CHARACTER.name: Tom Bombadil
CHARACTER.status: Master of wood, water, and hill

CHARACTER.name: Gildor Inglorion
CHARACTER.description: Leader of the Elves encountered in the Woody End

CHARACTER.name: Glorfindel
CHARACTER.description: Elf from Rivendell, sent to look for Frodo

CHARACTER.name: Thranduil
CHARACTER.description: King of the Elves of Northern Mirkwood

CHARACTER.name: Radagast
CHARACTER.description: The Brown, one of Gandalf's order

CHARACTER.name: Saruman
CHARACTER.description: The White, head of Gandalf's order, has turned traitor

CHARACTER.name: Gwaihir
CHARACTER.description: The Windlord, rescued Gandalf from Orthanc

CHARACTER.name: Bombur
CHARACTER.description: One of Thorin's companions, very fat

CHARACTER.name: Frár
CHARACTER.description: One of Balin's companions in Moria

CHARACTER.name: Lóni
CHARACTER.description: One of Balin's companions in Moria

CHARACTER.name: Náli
CHARACTER.description: One of Balin's companions in Moria

CHARACTER.name: Flói
CHARACTER.description: One of Balin's companions in Moria

CHARACTER.name: Galadriel
CHARACTER.description: Lady of Lothlórien, keeper of Nenya

CHARACTER.name: Haldir
CHARACTER.description: Elf of Lothlórien, guides the Company

CHARACTER.name: Nimrodel
CHARACTER.description: Elf-maiden of Lothlórien, lost in the mountains

CREATURE.name: Elves
CREATURE.description: Fair folk, often associated with magic, music, and immortality.  Various kinds of elves are mentioned, including High Elves (Noldor, Sindar), Silvan Elves (Galadhrim, Wood-elves), and others.
CREATURE.significance: Play a crucial role in the history and lore of Middle-earth, possessing wisdom and power. They aid the hobbits and other members of the Fellowship.

CREATURE.name: Dwarves
CREATURE.description: Stout, skilled craftspeople and miners, known for their love of gold and their intricate works of metal and stone.
CREATURE.significance: Bilbo's original adventure involved dwarves, and Gimli represents the dwarves in the Fellowship. They are impacted by the events surrounding the Ring.

CREATURE.name: Hobbits
CREATURE.description: Small, peace-loving folk, fond of simple pleasures and comfortable lives.
CREATURE.significance: The main protagonists of the story, including Bilbo and Frodo, are hobbits. Their involvement in the quest is unexpected but crucial.

CREATURE.name: Men
CREATURE.description: Humans, varying in their cultures and allegiances. Some are allies of the free peoples, while others are under the sway of Sauron.
CREATURE.significance: Men play a significant role in the conflicts of Middle-earth, both as allies and enemies. Boromir and Aragorn represent Men in the Fellowship.

CREATURE.name: Dark Lord
CREATURE.description: Sauron, the primary antagonist, a powerful sorcerer who created the One Ring and seeks to dominate Middle-earth.
CREATURE.significance: The driving force behind the conflict, his search for the Ring motivates the entire plot.

CREATURE.name: Orcs
CREATURE.description: Savage, brutal creatures who serve Sauron.
CREATURE.significance: Common enemies encountered throughout the journey, representing the pervasive threat of Sauron's forces.

CREATURE.name: Trolls
CREATURE.description: Large, dim-witted creatures, often encountered in mountainous regions.
CREATURE.significance: Obstacles and enemies encountered by the hobbits and their companions.

CREATURE.name: Dragons
CREATURE.description: Powerful, winged reptiles who hoard treasure and breathe fire.
CREATURE.significance: Dragons play a role in the backstory of The Hobbit and are mentioned as creatures of the past.

CREATURE.name: Ringwraiths
CREATURE.description: The Nine Servants of Sauron, also known as Black Riders or Nazgûl, once mortal men who were corrupted by the Nine Rings.
CREATURE.significance: Relentless pursuers of Frodo and the Ring, representing a constant and terrifying threat.

CREATURE.name: Gollum
CREATURE.description: A wretched creature, once a hobbit-like being, who was corrupted and twisted by the One Ring.
CREATURE.significance: Gollum's history is intertwined with the Ring, and he plays a significant role in its fate.

CREATURE.name: Tree-men
CREATURE.description: Giants, also known as Ents, who inhabit forests and are ancient and powerful.
CREATURE.significance: Mentioned in rumors and tales, though not directly encountered in The Fellowship of the Ring.

CREATURE.name: Wolves
CREATURE.description: Wild and dangerous predators, sometimes allied with Orcs.
CREATURE.significance: Creatures of the wild that pose a threat to travelers, particularly in the colder regions.

CREATURE.name: Wargs
CREATURE.description: Evil wolves, often used as mounts by Orcs.
CREATURE.significance: Enemies encountered by the Company, particularly in the mountainous regions.

CREATURE.name: Werewolves
CREATURE.description: Shapeshifters who can transform into wolves.
CREATURE.significance: Mentioned as servants of the Enemy, though not directly encountered in The Fellowship of the Ring.

CREATURE.name: Barrow-wights
CREATURE.description: Evil spirits that inhabit ancient barrows or burial mounds.
CREATURE.significance: Dangerous creatures encountered by the hobbits on the Barrow-downs.

CREATURE.name: Old Man Willow
CREATURE.description: A malevolent and ancient willow tree in the Old Forest.
CREATURE.significance: A dangerous and cunning creature encountered by the hobbits in the Old Forest.

CREATURE.name: Tom Bombadil
CREATURE.description: A mysterious and ancient being who is master of wood, water, and hill.
CREATURE.significance: A unique and enigmatic figure who aids the hobbits in the Old Forest, but remains detached from the larger conflict.

CREATURE.name: Goldberry
CREATURE.description: The River-daughter, Tom Bombadil's wife.
CREATURE.significance: A beautiful and benevolent being associated with nature and the River Withywindle.

CREATURE.name: Watcher in the Water
CREATURE.description: A monstrous creature that dwells in the lake outside the West-gate of Moria.
CREATURE.significance: A dangerous creature that guards the entrance to Moria and attacks the Fellowship.

CREATURE.name: Balrog
CREATURE.description: A powerful demon of fire and shadow, a creature of Morgoth from the ancient world.
CREATURE.significance: Durin's Bane, the Balrog of Moria, is a formidable foe that confronts Gandalf and causes his fall.

CREATURE.name: Eagles
CREATURE.description: Giant birds of prey that sometimes aid the free peoples.
CREATURE.significance: Allies who provide information and assistance, particularly to Gandalf.

CREATURE.name: Crebain
CREATURE.description: Large black crows used as spies by Saruman.
CREATURE.significance: Creatures used by the Enemy to gather information and track the Fellowship.

ORGANIZATION.name: White Council
ORGANIZATION.description: A council of Wise, including Gandalf and Saruman, that opposed the Dark Lord.
ORGANIZATION.significance: Drove the evil power from Mirkwood, but it later returned to Mordor.

ORGANIZATION.name: House of Finrod
ORGANIZATION.description: An Elven house or kindred, to which Gildor Inglorion belongs.
ORGANIZATION.significance: Gildor and his companions aid Frodo and his companions in the Woody End.

ORGANIZATION.name: Wandering Companies
ORGANIZATION.description: Groups of Elves who wander and keep watch.
ORGANIZATION.significance: Gildor promises to inform them of Frodo's journey.

EVENT.name: Bilbo's Unexpected Party
EVENT.summary: Bilbo Baggins throws a grand eleventy-first birthday party, surprising his guests with an unexpected announcement of his departure and a magical disappearance.

EVENT.name: Finding the Ring
EVENT.summary: Bilbo Baggins finds the One Ring in the goblin tunnels under the Misty Mountains during his journey with Thorin Oakenshield and company. He plays a riddle game with Gollum to escape and keeps the ring's true nature a secret for many years.

EVENT.name: Frodo Inherits the Ring
EVENT.summary: Bilbo leaves the Shire and his possessions, including the One Ring, to his nephew Frodo.

EVENT.name: Gandalf's Warning
EVENT.summary: Gandalf reveals the true nature of the One Ring to Frodo, explaining its history and the danger it poses.

EVENT.name: Departure from the Shire
EVENT.summary: Frodo, Sam, Merry, and Pippin leave Bag End secretly to avoid the Black Riders.

EVENT.name: Encounter with the Black Rider
EVENT.summary: The hobbits encounter a Black Rider on the road and narrowly avoid being discovered.

EVENT.name: Meeting with Gildor
EVENT.summary: The hobbits meet Gildor Inglorion and his company of Elves, who offer them shelter and warn them of the growing danger.

EVENT.name: Encounter at Farmer Maggot's
EVENT.summary: The hobbits encounter a Black Rider at Farmer Maggot's farm, but are mistaken for Frodo by Merry Brandybuck, who has come to meet them.

EVENT.name: Conspiracy Revealed
EVENT.summary: Merry, Pippin, and Sam reveal to Frodo that they know about the Ring and his plan to leave the Shire, and they insist on joining him.

EVENT.name: Escape to Crickhollow
EVENT.summary: The hobbits arrive at Crickhollow, Frodo's new house in Buckland, but are forced to leave quickly due to the Black Riders' pursuit.

EVENT.name: Old Forest and the Willow-man
EVENT.summary: The hobbits become trapped by Old Man Willow in the Old Forest, but are rescued by Tom Bombadil.

EVENT.name: Barrow-wight Encounter
EVENT.summary: The hobbits are captured by a Barrow-wight, but Frodo remembers Tom's song and calls for help, leading to their rescue.

EVENT.name: Meeting Glorfindel
EVENT.summary: The hobbits meet Glorfindel, an Elf-lord sent from Rivendell, who helps them escape the Black Riders.

EVENT.name: Flight to the Ford
EVENT.summary: The hobbits, pursued by the Black Riders, flee to the Ford of Bruinen, where a flood summoned by Elrond sweeps away the Ringwraiths.

EVENT.name: Council of Elrond
EVENT.summary: Representatives of the Free Peoples meet at Rivendell to discuss the One Ring and decide its fate. The Fellowship of the Ring is formed to take the Ring to Mordor.

ITEM.name: One Ring
ITEM.description: A ring of gold that makes its wearer invisible and grants power according to their stature. It corrupts the hearts of those who possess it, especially mortals, and its primary effect on them is to extend their lifespan while diminishing their vitality. It also draws the Ringwraiths towards its bearer.
ITEM.origin: Forged by Sauron in the fires of Mount Doom to control all other Rings of Power.

ITEM.name: Three Elven Rings
ITEM.description: Three rings of power hidden from Sauron, used for understanding, making, and healing.

ITEM.name: Seven Dwarf Rings
ITEM.description: Rings of power given to the Dwarf lords.
ITEM.current_status: Mostly consumed by dragons or recovered by Sauron

ITEM.name: Nine Rings for Mortal Men
ITEM.description: Rings of power that ensnared men and turned them into the Ringwraiths.

ITEM.name: Sting
ITEM.description: An Elvish knife that glows blue when Orcs are near.
ITEM.origin: Found by Bilbo in a troll hoard.

ITEM.name: Mithril Coat
ITEM.description: A shirt of mail made of mithril, light and strong, able to turn blades.
ITEM.origin: A gift from Thorin to Bilbo, made by Dwarves.

ITEM.name: Glamdring
ITEM.description: Gandalf's sword, the mate of Orcrist; glows when Orcs are near.
ITEM.origin: Found by Gandalf in a troll hoard.

ITEM.name: Andúril
ITEM.description: The reforged sword of Elendil, broken in the fight against Sauron.

ITEM.name: Boromir's Horn
ITEM.description: A great horn whose sound is meant to inspire courage and fear in the enemies of Gondor.
ITEM.origin: Heirloom of the Stewards of Gondor.

ITEM.name: Gimli's Axe
ITEM.description: A broad-bladed axe.

ITEM.name: Legolas' Bow
ITEM.description: A bow and quiver of arrows.

ITEM.name: Legolas' Knife
ITEM.description: A long white knife.

ITEM.name: Barrow Blades
ITEM.description: Swords taken from the barrow.

ITEM.name: Phial of Galadriel
ITEM.description: A small crystal phial containing the light of Eärendil's star.

ITEM.name: Elven Rope
ITEM.description: Rope made of hithlain, strong and light.
ITEM.origin: Made by the Elves of Lothlórien.

ITEM.name: Box of Earth
ITEM.description: A box containing blessed earth from Galadriel's orchard.

ITEM.name: Nenya
ITEM.description: One of the Three Elven Rings, the Ring of Adamant.

ITEM.name: Lembas
ITEM.description: Elven waybread, more strengthening than any food made by Men.
ITEM.origin: Made by the Elves of Lothlórien.

ITEM.name: Elvish Cloaks
ITEM.description: Cloaks made of a special silken stuff that helps wearers blend in with their surroundings.
ITEM.origin: Made by Galadriel and her maidens.

ITEM.name: Morgul Knife
ITEM.description: A knife used by the Ringwraiths, its wounds turn the victim into a wraith.
ITEM.current_status: Broken by Frodo, a fragment remained in his shoulder

ITEM.name: Book of Mazarbul
ITEM.description: A record of the fortunes of Balin's folk in Moria.

ITEM.name: Elessar
ITEM.description: A green Elfstone set in a silver brooch shaped like an eagle.
ITEM.origin: Originally given by Galadriel to her daughter Celebrían.

chapters: Chapter 7: IN THE HOUSE OF TOM BOMBADIL

Event_CAUSED.method: Got lost in the goblin tunnels and stumbled upon it
Revealed the Ring's nature to Frodo
Revealed their knowledge of the Ring to Frodo
The hobbits trespassed and were trapped
The hobbits trespassed and were trapped
The hobbits trespassed on his land, leading to the encounter
Announced his departure and left the Shire
Lost the Ring in the goblin tunnels
Lost the ring while hunting orcs

traits: Art of disappearing swiftly and silently
Art of disappearing swiftly and silently
Art of disappearing swiftly and silently
Art of disappearing swiftly and silently
Art of disappearing swiftly and silently
